page.title: 08The oldest man in Britain
page.content: Mr. John Evans is the oldest man in Britain, he is 107 years old and lives in a detached cottage at Llewithia. While we were there, he told us how the area of Cadle got its name.In Welsh Cad means battle and Lle means place,so Cadle is the place of battle. One of the last princes of Wales was Hywel ap Meredudd. He fought for the Welsh against the Normans.One of his battles took place on Garngoch Common. While he was at school he wrote on slate using a pencil shaped piece of chalk.If he was late or naughty etc., he would have had the cane. When he got to school the headmaster would mark the register in the main hall.
